summary: Immediate priority: remove/disable all permission checks across the entire Admin area (frontend admin folder and any remaining backend guards) so Orders, Categories, and Products are fully accessible without any 'Unauthorized'/'No Permission' errors; admin access must be completely open during this phase.
architectural_notes: Cross-platform mobile app (Android + iOS) with clean, minimal UI inspired by Amazon/Flipkart.
Backend to use Firebase or Supabase, including secure authentication, real-time database updates, and cloud image storage.
Payments must support Razorpay, Stripe, and Cash on Delivery.
Include admin panel capabilities for catalog/order/user management and sales analytics.
Seed the app with 3 sample products (including image URLs or bundled placeholder assets) to demonstrate add-to-cart flow and cart badge count in header.
Admin panel authentication must use a simple username/password login (no Internet Identity) with secure credential storage and session/token-based access control for admin routes/APIs.
Admin credentials need a defined reset/default-password process for deployment; user requested resetting the admin password and redeploying to restore access.
Admin dashboard should include a 'Site Settings' section for branding (shop name + logo upload/change).
Branding/shop name must be set to "BISAULI" and reflected both in the shopper header UI and in SEO title metadata (document title / meta tags).
Temporarily disable admin authentication and route gating: remove /admin/login requirement and allow direct access to /admin (no username/password) until re-enabled later.
known_issues: Automated build for the smart search feature failed with: “AI couldn't process your request successfully. Try simplifying or rewording it.”
Admin panel deployment/build failed (deployment encountered an error); needs fix and redeploy so draft is accessible.
On the Access Denied page, the “Back to login” button/link is broken and does not navigate to the admin login form; needs link/route fix.
Admin password is unknown/not set from the user's perspective; requires password reset and redeploy to restore admin access.
Admin login page shows: "Admin login is not yet configured on the backend"; backend admin username/password login logic needs to be implemented/configured so credentials (admin / Admin@123) work.
Branding/shop name reverted back to "Canfinity Store" after deployment; must be fixed so "BISAULI" persists permanently.
Admin login remains invalid after deployment; user requests temporarily removing admin login and all password protection.
Admin Products page shows "Something went wrong!" when opened; likely backend/actor/database connection failure preventing listing/CRUD so admin cannot add items.
Admin Categories page has the same backend/actor/database connection failure; needs fix so categories can be managed.
Admin "Site Settings" page is not working as expected (logo upload/change flow failing); needs fix so branding/logo can be updated.

existing_features.title: Create the ShopEase app shell with smooth navigation and fast-loading pages, including a coherent modern visual theme (clean, minimal, Amazon/Flipkart-inspired) applied consistently across all screens.
Implement authentication using Internet Identity and store a user profile linked to the authenticated Principal; include login/logout UI and protected routes for user-only and admin-only areas.
Build the shopper Home page with banner carousel/strip, featured products, and categories, with navigation into category/product listing.
Implement product listing (catalog) with filtering (price range, rating threshold, category) and sorting options, plus pagination or incremental loading for performance.
Implement product details page with image carousel, description, price, and reviews/ratings display, plus actions to add to cart and wishlist.
Implement cart management (add/remove/update quantity) and wishlist management (add/remove, list view) persisted per user in the backend.
Implement checkout flow with address management and order placement; include secure order summary and create an order record with status history.
Add payment options selection at checkout: Stripe payment option and Cash on Delivery (COD). Record the selected payment method and payment status on the order.
Implement order history and order tracking with “live” status updates by periodically refreshing order status from the backend, and display a status timeline per order.
Create the user profile section with tabs/pages for My Orders, Addresses, and Settings.

Implement an admin panel with admin login gating, including: product management (add/edit/delete, images, price, inventory), category management, order management (view/update status), user management (view), and a sales analytics dashboard (daily/weekly/monthly summaries).
Implement coupons/discount system that supports creating coupon codes (admin) and applying a coupon at checkout (user) with validation rules and discount calculation.
Implement a referral system that generates a referral code per user and records referral attribution when a new user signs up via a code, with simple referral stats in the profile.
Add dark mode support with a theme toggle and ensure all main screens are readable and visually consistent in both light and dark themes.
Add multi-language support for English and Hindi across shopper and admin UI, with a language switcher and translated labels/messages.
Implement product image handling by storing image URLs in product records and serving any app-provided default images as static frontend assets (no backend image storage).

Add frontend data fetching via React Query with caching, pagination, and invalidation for admin mutations; optimize key screens for perceived performance (skeletons, memoized lists where appropriate).
Provide deployment instructions for building and deploying the app to the Internet Computer using the project’s standard tooling, including local development steps and production deployment steps.
Add generated static assets (logo, banners, placeholders) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI where appropriate (e.g., header logo, home banners, product placeholders).

Update the header to always show a Cart icon entry that navigates to /cart, and display an item-count badge on the Cart icon that reflects the current cart quantity sum (0 when unauthenticated or empty).

Add a simple “Add to Cart” button to each product card in the product grid (e.g., Home featured products and Catalog listing) that adds 1 quantity of that product to the authenticated user’s cart; if unauthenticated, show an English error toast prompting the user to login.

Seed exactly 3 sample products in the backend product catalog (with non-empty name, description, price, stock, categoryId, and imageUrl pointing to static frontend assets) so they appear in Home featured products and Catalog immediately after deployment when the product list is empty.

Upgrade the existing Admin Products page (`frontend/src/pages/admin/AdminProductsPage.tsx`) from a count-only placeholder to a simple product management UI that lets an admin list products and add, edit, and delete products using the Motoko backend, with React Query mutations and cache invalidation.

Add frontend React Query hooks for admin product mutations (create/update/delete) that call the new backend methods via the existing actor pattern, and invalidate `queryKeys.products` after successful mutations.

Identify the root cause of the current deployment/build error preventing the ShopEase frontend (including the /admin routes) from deploying, and implement the minimal code/config changes needed to make the project build and deploy successfully.

After fixing the deployment error, ensure the admin panel is accessible in the deployed draft at the /admin route (including navigation to /admin/products, /admin/categories, /admin/orders, /admin/users, /admin/coupons, and /admin/stripe-setup) under the existing Internet Identity admin-gating behavior.
Add a product quick-search input to the shopper header (frontend/src/components/layout/Header.tsx) that lets users type a query and navigate to the Catalog page with the query applied.
Extend the Catalog page (frontend/src/pages/CatalogPage.tsx) to read the search query from the URL and include it in the product fetch filters so search results are reflected in the product grid.
Add quick search and sorting controls to the Admin Products page (frontend/src/pages/admin/AdminProductsPage.tsx) so an admin can quickly find and organize products.
Add a dedicated admin username/password login flow for the admin panel that does not rely on Internet Identity, including a new admin login route and UI form.
Persist the admin token in the frontend for the current browser session and ensure it is applied to backend actor initialization so admin-only API calls succeed without Internet Identity.
Update admin route gating to stop requiring an Internet Identity identity object for admin access, and instead gate by admin-token authentication state and/or backend admin authorization check.

Provide clear English documentation in the frontend README (or an appropriate existing doc location) that states the admin login URL and how to set/configure the default admin username and password for local development and deployment.
Fix the “Back to Login” button on the Admin “Access Denied” screen so it always navigates to the admin login form route `/admin/login`.

Ensure the default admin username is clearly communicated in-app and in documentation: confirm the admin login route is `/admin/login` and the default admin username is `admin` (English user-facing text).
Update the admin login UI copy to reflect the reset password in English (do not change the username text), so the login screen does not incorrectly state that the password was set during deployment.
Remove all Internet Identity (II) requirements from the admin login experience so that the /admin area does not require an Internet Identity session to log in or to access the dashboard.
Set the admin credentials to username "admin" and password "Admin@123" and ensure these credentials successfully authenticate immediately after deployment.

Update admin route gating so that access to /admin and all nested admin routes is controlled only by the admin session/token state (and optional backend token validation), and does not depend on the caller Principal ID or Internet Identity.
Update the admin frontend to create/use a backend actor for admin pages that applies the stored admin token even when the user is not logged in with Internet Identity.

Ensure the admin login flow succeeds with username "admin" and password "Admin@123" using the existing Admin Login UI (`frontend/src/pages/admin/AdminLoginPage.tsx`) and the backend `adminAuthenticate(username, password)` method, without requiring Internet Identity for admin access.

Add a new Admin page for "Site Settings" and add it as a new navigation item (tab/link) in the Admin sidebar (`frontend/src/pages/admin/AdminLayoutPage.tsx`) so admins can open it from the admin dashboard area.

Implement the Admin "Site Settings" page UI to (1) edit Shop Name, (2) upload/select a new Logo image file, (3) preview the chosen logo before saving, and (4) save changes to the backend. Use English for all labels, helper text, and validation messages.

Reflect the configured branding on the shopper UI by rendering the saved Shop Name and Logo in the main shopper header (`frontend/src/components/layout/Header.tsx`) in place of the hard-coded ShopEase logo assets when Site Settings are present.
Set the site/shop name to "BISAULI" (replacing any existing default such as "Aurora") so that the shopper header displays "BISAULI" as the brand name via Site Settings.

Update SEO-visible page title to use "BISAULI" by (1) updating the base HTML document <title> and (2) ensuring the runtime document title reflects the configured shop name when Site Settings are loaded.

Fix the failing build by identifying and resolving all current TypeScript and Motoko compile errors/regressions introduced by recent changes, with the goal of producing a clean production build that includes the /admin routes.
Provide a fresh, basic admin login page at route `/admin/login` that authenticates using username `admin` and password `Admin@123`, with only essential UI and English user-facing text.

Deliver a deploy-ready version: after implementing the above changes, ensure the application can be deployed and the production deployment includes the updated "BISAULI" branding and a working admin login.
Remove all admin route protection so the /admin dashboard and all nested admin routes are directly accessible without any username/password, token, or redirects to /admin/login.
Completely remove the Admin Login page from the app routing and UI entry points so /admin/login is not used for access during this phase.
Permanently enforce the site/shop name as "BISAULI" so it does not revert to "Canfinity Store" after deployment or canister upgrades, while still allowing reading site settings from the backend.
Redeploy the application after implementing these changes and provide the production/draft URLs for direct access to /admin and the main site.

Fix the Admin Products page so it loads product data from the Motoko backend without showing a generic route error (e.g., "Something went wrong!") when accessed at `/admin/products`. Use the admin/anonymous backend actor for admin pages instead of the Internet Identity–bound actor.

Fix the Admin Categories page so it loads category data from the Motoko backend without showing a generic route error when accessed at `/admin/categories`. Use the admin/anonymous backend actor for admin pages instead of the Internet Identity–bound actor.

Ensure the Admin Products and Admin Categories pages support adding items by wiring their create/update/delete actions to the existing backend methods (`addProduct`, `updateProduct`, `deleteProduct`, `addCategory`, `updateCategory`, `deleteCategory`) and updating the UI so an admin can create at least a basic product/category record from the admin pages.

Make the Admin “Site Settings” page fully functional so a logo can be uploaded and saved to the backend, and the saved logo is visible again after reload. Ensure Site Settings reading and updating do not depend on an Internet Identity session.

Fix the `/admin/products` route so it no longer renders the generic route error screen ("Something went wrong!") and instead reliably loads the products list from the Motoko backend using the admin/anonymous actor with safe, non-crashing filter/sort construction.

Ensure the "Add Product" action on `/admin/products` always opens a visible, usable Add Product form dialog (ProductEditorDialog) with all required fields rendered, and it remains functional even when categories are empty or fail to load (show an English inline message in the dialog rather than crashing).

Verify `/admin/categories` loads categories from the Motoko backend using the admin/anonymous actor and that the "Add Category" dialog is usable so the admin can organize the shop; fix any remaining route-level error issues and ensure CRUD actions are wired and do not crash the page.
Redeploy the application after implementing the fixes and verify in the deployed build that `/admin/products` and `/admin/categories` work as expected and the "Add Product" form is visible.

Fix the Admin sidebar navigation so all sidebar menu items are clickable and route correctly to their pages (/admin/categories, /admin/orders, /admin/site-settings, etc.), including when the global shopper Header is present.
Ensure the Admin dashboard routes render without route-level errors for Categories, Orders, and Site Settings, and that they display stable loading/empty/error states in English.

Unblock adding products by improving the Admin Products "no categories" experience: when no categories exist, show a clear English message and provide an in-UI action to navigate to /admin/categories to create one (without requiring the sidebar).

Update the admin Categories and Products CRUD UI flows to handle backend unavailability errors (including IC0508 "Canister is stopped") gracefully: show a clear English error message and provide a retry action rather than rendering a generic failure or leaving the UI in a broken/loading state.

Redeploy the application after implementing the backend authorization changes and backend availability fix, and verify that `/admin`, `/admin/categories`, and `/admin/products` allow full CRUD access without authentication.

Replace the "Image URL" text input in the Admin "Add New Product" / "Edit Product" dialog (`frontend/src/components/admin/ProductEditorDialog.tsx`) with an image file upload control that lets an admin select an image from their device (phone/computer).

Add an inline preview of the selected product image in `ProductEditorDialog`, and store the selected image in the form state as a Data URL string so it can be persisted via the existing `Product.imageUrl : Text` field.

Persist and render uploaded product images end-to-end by ensuring products saved with a Data URL `imageUrl` display correctly across shopper-facing surfaces that render products (including the Home page featured product grid).

Add basic, English validation and guidance for product image uploads in `ProductEditorDialog` to prevent broken saves and improve usability (e.g., non-image file selection, and a clear way to remove/clear a selected image before saving).

Replace the current checkout "Shipping Address" placeholder on `frontend/src/pages/CheckoutPage.tsx` with a working "Shipping Address" form containing the following fields: Name, Phone, Full Address, and Pincode, with English labels and validation errors.

Update `frontend/src/pages/CartPage.tsx` to show functional quantity controls ("+" and "-") for each cart line item and wire them to backend mutations so customers can change product quantities from the cart UI.

Fix the checkout "Place Order" behavior in `frontend/src/pages/CheckoutPage.tsx` so the button is reliably clickable when the form and cart are valid, calls the backend to persist the order (including shipping address + item quantities), and shows a customer-facing English success message before navigating to the order confirmation screen.

Make the Admin Orders section (`frontend/src/pages/admin/AdminOrdersPage.tsx`) show real order data from the backend (instead of the "Coming Soon" placeholder), including shipping address details and per-item quantities, so admins can verify what customers submitted at checkout.
Clear the deployment/build cache and retry deployment so the latest frontend and backend changes are actually pushed live to the Internet Computer.

If deployment fails again, identify the exact build/deploy error (TypeScript build, Motoko compile, asset build, or canister deploy step), implement the minimal fixes required, and re-run deployment until it succeeds.

When deployment errors indicate backend connectivity or availability issues, check backend canister logs, ensure the backend canister is running and reachable, and fix any connection/availability issues so frontend can reliably call backend methods.

Ensure the deployed production app includes and verifies the checkout/cart fixes: a working Shipping Address form on `frontend/src/pages/CheckoutPage.tsx` (Name, Phone, Full Address, Pincode), functional cart quantity +/- controls on `frontend/src/pages/CartPage.tsx`, and a reliably clickable “Place Order” button that creates/persists the order (including shipping details and item quantities) and shows an English success message before navigating.
Redeploy after implementing the above and confirm the site is live with the updated checkout/cart behavior in a fresh session (no cached state).

Ensure the admin UI does not ask for login and does not block saving categories/products due to any frontend-side authorization gating; admin pages must rely on the existing anonymous admin actor for CRUD and surface backend errors in English without redirecting to `/admin/login`.

Fix the recurring "Deployment ran into an issue" situation by clearing the build/deployment cache, ensuring the backend canister is running and reachable, and redeploying so the latest backend authorization removals and admin CRUD functionality are live.

Replace the Checkout page placeholder text "Address management will be available soon" with a real, visible Shipping/Delivery Address form that collects exactly these fields in English: Customer Name, Mobile Number, Full Address, and Pincode.

Ensure the Checkout "Place Order" button becomes enabled/clickable only when the address form is valid (not just non-empty) and the cart has at least 1 item; show clear English validation errors when invalid.

Make the Admin Orders page show real order data from the backend (not the "Coming Soon" placeholder), including each order’s shipping address details and per-item quantities so the admin can fulfill deliveries.

Add a status update control to `frontend/src/pages/admin/AdminOrdersPage.tsx`: replace the read-only status badge cell with a dropdown (select) that shows the current status and allows updating it to "Confirmed", "Shipped", or "Delivered" with English labels.

Create a React Query mutation hook for updating order status using the admin actor (e.g., in `frontend/src/hooks/queries/useAdminOrders.ts`), and ensure it invalidates/refreshes both `queryKeys.adminOrders` and customer order queries (`queryKeys.orders` and the relevant `queryKeys.order(id)`) after a successful update.

Ensure customers can see updated order statuses on the shopper UI: update `frontend/src/pages/orders/MyOrdersPage.tsx` (and `frontend/src/pages/orders/OrderDetailsPage.tsx` where applicable) to display the new statuses (Confirmed/Shipped/Delivered) with English labels, and add a periodic refresh so status changes made by admin become visible without requiring a manual reload.

Update the shopper header (`frontend/src/components/layout/Header.tsx`) so the product search input is prominently visible directly in the header/navigation bar (not only inside the mobile three-dot/hamburger menu). Place it next to the BISAULI logo and/or near the Cart icon so customers can see it immediately.

Make the header search UI clean and responsive across mobile and desktop: ensure the search input has appropriate width/spacing, does not overlap the logo or action icons, and remains usable (readable placeholder text, clear focus state) in both light and dark themes.

Ensure the header search placeholder and any related search UI text render in English correctly by adding/using a valid i18n key (the current `t('search.placeholder')` must not render as the raw key string).

Implement real Admin Dashboard stats sourced from backend orders: (1) Total Orders must count all orders returned by the backend, (2) Total Sales/Revenue must equal the sum of all orders’ totalAmount, and (3) add a “Refresh Stats” button that manually refetches the stats.

Add a dedicated React Query cache key and query flow for Admin Dashboard stats, and ensure the Dashboard automatically updates when a new order is placed and when an order status is updated by an admin.
Fix the Admin Categories “Unauthorized” error so categories can be added/updated/deleted from the admin UI without permission blocks, using clear English error handling when failures occur.
Build and deploy the update after implementing the Dashboard stats sync and Categories Unauthorized fix, ensuring the production build is clean and the changes are live.

Remove all frontend-side permission checks / role gating / admin-authorization UI blocks within `frontend/src/pages/admin/**`, `frontend/src/components/admin/**`, and admin query/mutation hooks so Admin pages never show 'Unauthorized' / 'No Permission' popups and never block actions due to permission state during the open-admin phase.

Ensure Admin Orders data loading and status update flows use the anonymous/admin actor path consistently (no Internet Identity role checks) and that errors are surfaced as clear English operational messages (backend unavailable, validation, not found) rather than permission messaging.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement user authentication: signup/login via Email, Phone OTP, and Google login
Create Home page with banners, featured products, and categories
Build product listing with filters (price, rating, category) and sorting
Build product details page with image carousel, description, price, reviews, and ratings
Implement Cart and Wishlist features
Implement secure checkout flow
Integrate payments: Razorpay, Stripe, and Cash on Delivery options
Implement order tracking with live status updates
Create user profile section (My Orders, Address, Settings)
Add push notifications for offers and order updates
Build admin panel: admin login/dashboard; manage products, categories, orders, users; sales analytics reports
Implement backend using Firebase or Supabase with secure auth, real-time updates, and cloud image storage
Add coupon & discount system
Add referral system
Add dark mode support
Add multi-language support (English + Hindi)
Ensure responsive, fast, performance-optimized UI and provide structured code + deployment instructions

Design backend data models and Motoko APIs to support: users, admins, products, categories, banners, reviews, cart, wishlist, addresses, coupons, referrals, orders, and order status history; ensure stable persistence across canister upgrades.
Add header shopping cart icon (with item count badge), basic “Add to Cart” button on product cards/pages, and seed 3 sample products with images
Build a simple admin panel to add, edit, and delete products (CRUD) using the existing Motoko backend

Add admin-only backend APIs in `backend/main.mo` to create, update, and delete products in the product catalog, reusing the existing `Product` type and enforcing that only admins can perform these mutations.
Add a search bar in the shopper Home page header for users to quickly search products
Add quick search and sorting controls in the admin panel (e.g., Admin Products management) to find and organize products more efficiently

Update the backend product filtering API (backend/main.mo: getProducts(filters : [Filter])) to support a text search filter for matching products by name (and optionally description) in a case-insensitive manner.

If current backend sorting options are insufficient for the Admin Products page sorting UI, extend backend Filter/getProducts to support the additional sort(s) needed (e.g., sorting by name) while keeping compatibility with existing consumers (Catalog page).
Add a 'Site Settings' tab in the admin dashboard to update the Shop Name and upload/change the site Logo (branding settings)

Add backend support for site-wide branding settings by introducing a persisted Site Settings record that stores (1) Shop Name (Text) and (2) Logo (Text, stored as a data URL string or a plain URL string). Provide backend methods to read and update these settings, where updates are admin-only.
Update SEO metadata so the site/shop name (set to "BISAULI") appears in the browser/Google SEO title (document title and relevant meta tags) in addition to the header branding
Remove the admin login page and disable all admin password protection temporarily; allow direct access to /admin dashboard without username/password

Temporarily disable backend admin authorization checks for admin-only operations so the admin UI functions can be used without any authentication, including: product mutations, category mutations, coupon mutations, order status updates, stripe configuration updates, and site settings updates.

Fix Admin sidebar navigation so dashboard links (Categories, Orders, Settings) are clickable and route correctly; ensure these admin pages load and function so categories can be created and products can be added.

Investigate and resolve the root cause of the backend canister becoming stopped (IC0508) during admin catalog mutations (e.g., adding a category named "cloths"), and implement the minimal backend changes required so the canister remains running and responsive during category and product CRUD operations.

Add a lightweight backend health/status query method that never traps and can be used to confirm the backend canister is running (returns an English status payload indicating the service is available).

Remove/disable all backend "admin-only" permission checks that block the Admin Dashboard CRUD flows, so any caller (including anonymous) can add, update, and delete categories and products without receiving "Unauthorized" errors.

Align remaining Admin Dashboard backend APIs to not require admin authorization checks during this phase (so /admin pages do not break due to hidden admin-only guards), while keeping existing user-only checks for shopper features (cart/wishlist/profile/orders) intact.

Resolve the "Canister is stopped" (IC0508) failure mode for admin catalog mutations by ensuring the backend canister remains running and responsive during category/product CRUD, and ensure the backend health check can be used to confirm service availability.

Replace the Image URL field in the Admin 'Add Product' form with an image File Upload button; persist the uploaded image (storage strategy TBD) and ensure the saved product image displays on the home page/product listings after save/reload.
Checkout: Add Shipping Address form (Name, Phone, Full Address, Pincode) and persist it with the order.
Cart: Enable quantity increment/decrement (+/-) buttons so customers can change product quantities and persist updates.

Checkout: Fix 'Place Order' button not clickable; ensure it creates/saves the order to the database, shows a success message, and the order (with address + line items/quantities) appears in Admin Orders.

Extend the backend order model and APIs in `backend/main.mo` to persist shipping address details with each order, and expose an order-creation method that the checkout page can call to create an order from the caller’s cart items (including quantities).

Add backend cart quantity update capability in `backend/main.mo` so the frontend can increment/decrement or set quantity for a cart item while enforcing basic constraints (e.g., quantity bounds and product existence).

Remove all backend authorization checks that block anonymous callers from adding, updating, or deleting categories and products, so the Admin dashboard at `/admin` can perform category/product CRUD without any authentication.

Ensure the backend order placement persists the provided shipping address (Customer Name, Mobile Number, Full Address, Pincode) inside the stored Order record so it is retrievable later via order queries.

Ensure the Admin Orders data fetch works with the current no-login admin phase by making the backend method used by the Admin Orders page callable without requiring an admin Internet Identity session or admin permission checks that would block the open admin panel.

Admin Orders: add an order-status dropdown (Confirmed/Shipped/Delivered) to update status from Pending; persist to backend and reflect the updated status to customers on My Orders (and optionally via notification).

Extend the backend `OrderStatus` type in `backend/main.mo` to support the admin-manageable statuses "Confirmed", "Shipped", and "Delivered" (in addition to existing statuses), and ensure all order records can store and return these statuses without trapping.

Update the backend `updateOrderStatus(orderId, newStatus)` method in `backend/main.mo` so that the Admin panel can successfully change order status during the current no-login admin phase (i.e., do not block the call due to admin authorization checks), and ensure `statusHistory` is appended with each change.

Make the shopper Search Bar prominently visible in the main Header/Navigation bar (not inside the three-dot menu); place a clean, responsive search input next to the BISAULI logo and/or Cart icon for both mobile and desktop.

Remove all frontend-side permission checks/authorization gating across the entire Admin folder so Admin Orders/Categories/Products are fully accessible with no 'Unauthorized'/'No Permission' popups during the open-admin phase.

Remove all backend admin-only permission checks that can cause 'Unauthorized', 'No Permission', or 'You do not have permission' failures for Admin functionality, so any caller (including anonymous) can view and manage Orders, Categories, Products, Coupons, Site Settings, and Stripe setup during the open-admin phase.
